theme: Health system performance,Child health,Population and reproductive health,Nutrition and food security,Administrative and civil service reform

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Third Health Project (HPIII) in
            Indonesia. The objectives of the project were to raise the
            health status of the population in Kaltim and Nusa Tenggara
            Barat (NTB) by improving service coverage and quality in the
            project provinces, increasing efficiency in the use of
            available resources, encouraging greater resource
            mobilization at the province level, and strengthening
            institutional capabilities for management and service
            delivery at the provincial and central levels. The
            performance of the Bank was highly satisfactory. Borrower
            performance was highly satisfactory. The key lessons learned
            were as follows: (i) local government involvement is vital
            to the success of any decentralization effort; (ii) greater
            transparency in the use of authority, especially in
            assignment of responsibility and accountability, were also
            key factors in success with decentralization; (iii) the
            results of the study were delayed and not available in time
            to effect the project outcome, although the knowledge of
            household behavior provided by the study will be useful in
            assessing demand for health services in future projects; and
            (iv) the attractive and effective rehabilitation of the old
            hospital at Mataram could be instructive for future project design.
